Title: How to prove $ \prod_{d|n} d= n^{\frac{\tau (n)}{2}}$
Content: how to prove: $$ \prod_{d|n} d= n^{\frac{\tau (n)}{2}}$$ $\prod_{d|n} d$ is product of all of distinct positive divisor of $n$, $\tau (n)$ is number (count)of all of positive divisor of $n$
AcceptedAnswer: Hint: If $k$ divides $n$, then $\frac {n}{k}$ is an integer that divides $n$. This allows you to pair up the divisors, to show that $$(\prod_{d \mid n} d )^2 = \prod_{d \mid n} n = n^{\tau(n)}.$$ Elaborated: $$(\prod_{d \mid n} d )^2 = (\prod_{d \mid n} d ) ( \prod_{d \mid n} \frac {n}{d} ) = \prod_{d \mid n} d \times \frac {n}{d} = \prod_{d \mid n} n = n^{\tau(n)}.$$
